item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 16, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (114 points | 33 comments)
2. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (68 points | 25 comments)
3. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (43 points | 10 comments)
4. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (93 points | 36 comments)
5. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (165 points | 49 comments)
6. Military's UFO-hunting aerial surveillance system detailed in report (39 points | 14 comments)
7. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (28 points | 4 comments)
8. Yggdrasil Network (200 points | 71 comments)
9. Treating bullying as everyone's problem reduces incidence in primary schools (61 points | 25 comments)
10. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (67 points | 4 comments)
11. Netflix buffering issues: Boxing fans complain about Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson (312 points | 578 comments)
12. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (55 points | 8 comments)
13. New haptic patch transmits complexity of touch to the skin (7 points | discuss)
14. I tried every top email marketing tool (64 points | 55 comments)
15. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (25 points | 3 comments)
16. AI isn't unleashing imaginations, it's outsourcing them (17 points | 2 comments)
17. Is the UK's liver transplant matching algorithm biased against younger patients? (68 points | 32 comments)
18. Virtual Shoe Museum (6 points | 1 comment)
19. The race to commercialise nuclear-powered batteries (24 points | 7 comments)
20. C Compiler to SPIR-V (46 points | 2 comments)
21. Show HN: Android Dev Quest – A puzzle game solvable only using developer tools (52 points | 5 comments)
22. PermitFlow (YC W22) is hiring senior/staff engineers in NYC ( | hide)
23. Pleasant Debugging with GDB and DDD (47 points | 1 comment)
24. Kyanos: eBPF-based network issue analysis tool (164 points | 13 comments)
25. Casio has released a ring in the form of its iconic watch (120 points | 53 comments)
26. Where Does the Magic Go as We Grow Older? (2020) (5 points | 3 comments)
27. Surveillance and the history of 19th-century wearable tech (44 points | 9 comments)
28. YC is wrong about LLMs for chip design (164 points | 144 comments)
29. Nixie Tubes (2015) (126 points | 37 comments)
30. Dtype_dispatch: a macro that defines macros that define enums and match them (11 points | 1 comment)
